pred: The GhostVLAD approach is a pooling strategy that was originally proposed for face recognition and has been used to improve language identification performance for Indian languages. It involves adding ghost clusters to the traditional VLAD approach to reduce the impact of noisy or irrelevant content on the feature aggregation process. The approach has been shown to outperform previous state-of-the-art methods by an absolute 1.88% F1-score.
answers: extension of the NetVLAD, adds Ghost clusters along with the NetVLAD clusters
An extension of NetVLAD which replaces hard assignment-based clustering with soft assignment-based clustering with the additon o fusing Ghost clusters to deal with noisy content.

pred: They combine audio and text sequences in their RNN by concatenating the final encoding vectors from the audio and text RNNs and passing them through a fully connected neural network layer to generate a final encoding vector. This final encoding vector is then passed through a softmax function to predict the emotion class. They also propose a multimodal attention mechanism to focus on specific parts of the text that contain strong emotional information, conditioned on the audio information. The attention mechanism is applied to the final encoding vector from the audio RNN and the weighted sum of the text RNN's hidden states, which is calculated based on the attention scores. The final prediction is
answers: combines the information from these sources using a feed-forward neural model
encodes the information from audio and text sequences using dual RNNs and then combines the information from these sources using a feed-forward neural model

pred: They obtain the new context representation by splitting the context into three disjoint regions based on the two relation arguments and then combining the left context, left entity, and middle context, as well as the middle context, right entity, and right context. They also repeat the middle context to increase the chance of the max pooling step picking a value from the middle context.
answers: They use two independent convolutional and max-pooling layers on (1) a combination of the left context, the left entity and the middle context; and (2) a combination of the middle context, the right entity and the right context. They concatenated the two results after pooling to get the new context representation.

pred: The invertibility condition is a constraint on the neural projector that ensures exact inference and marginal likelihood computation. It requires that the neural projector be invertible and have a volume-preserving property. This constraint allows for the calculation of the marginal emission factor in Eq. (EQREF19) and enables optimization of the model without information loss.
answers: The neural projector must be invertible.
we constrain our neural projector with two requirements: (1) INLINEFORM0 and (2) INLINEFORM1 exists

pred: The proposed qualitative annotation schema looks like a framework to categorize gold standards according to linguistic complexity, required reasoning, and factual correctness. pred: The baselines are the vanilla ST model, the pre-training baselines, the multi-task baselines, the many-to-many+pre-training baseline, and the triangle+pre-train baseline.
answers: Vanilla ST baseline, encoder pre-training, in which the ST encoder is initialized from an ASR model, decoder pre-training, in which the ST decoder is initialized from an MT model, encoder-decoder pre-training, where both the encoder and decoder are pre-trained, many-to-many multi-task model where the encoders and decoders are derived from pre-trained ASR and MT models, Triangle+pre-train: BIBREF18 DBLP:conf/naacl/AnastasopoulosC18 proposed a triangle multi-task strategy for speech translation
Vanilla ST baseline, Pre-training baselines, Multi-task baselines, Many-to-many+pre-training, Triangle+pre-train

Vanilla ST baseline: The vanilla ST BIBREF9 has only a speech encoder and a decoder. It is trained from scratch on the ST-TED corpus.

Pre-training baselines: We conduct three pre-training baseline experiments: 1) encoder pre-training, in which the ST encoder is initialized from an ASR model; 2) decoder pre-training, in which the ST decoder is initialized from an MT model; and 3) encoder-decoder pre-training, where both the encoder and decoder are pre-trained. The ASR model has the same architecture with vanilla ST model, trained on the mixture of ST-TED and TED-LIUM2 corpus. The MT model has a text encoder and decoder with the same architecture of which in TCEN. It is first trained on WMT data (out-of-domain) and then fine-tuned on in-domain data.

Multi-task baselines: We also conduct three multi-task baseline experiments including one-to-many setting, many-to-one setting, and many-to-many setting. In the first two settings, we train the model with $\alpha _{st}=0.75$ while $\alpha _{asr}=0.25$ or $\alpha _{mt}=0.25$. For many-to-many setting, we use $\alpha _{st}=0.6, \alpha _{asr}=0.2$ and $\alpha _{mt}=0.2$.. For MT task, we use only in-domain data.

Many-to-many+pre-training: We train a many-to-many multi-task model where the encoders and decoders are derived from pre-trained ASR and MT models.

The subjects were presented with a series of visual stimuli, including a fixation cross, a house, and a face. The house and face stimuli were presented for 500 ms each, with a 500 ms inter-stimulus interval. The fixation cross was presented for 1000 ms. The subjects were instructed to press a button when they saw the face stimulus. The house stimulus served as a control condition. The stimuli were presented in a randomized order, with each stimulus presented 100 times. The subjects were instructed to maintain fixation on the screen during the experiment. The experiment lasted approximately 20 minutes.

pred: The article uses two types of language model architectures: a bi-directional language model to augment the sequence to sequence encoder and a uni-directional model to augment the decoder. Both models use self-attention and the uni-directional model contains 6 transformer blocks, followed by a word classifier to predict the next word on the right. The bi-directional model consists of two towers, the forward tower operating left-to-right and the backward tower operating right-to-left, and the forward and backward representations are combined via a self-attention module to predict the token at position 2. The models use the standard settings for the Big Transformer and are trained
answers: uni-directional model to augment the decoder
bi-directional language model to augment the sequence to sequence encoder ,  uni-directional model to augment the decoder

pred: Weights are dynamically adjusted by multiplying the soft probability with a decaying factor. This helps to deemphasize confident examples during training and makes the model more attentive to hard-negative examples. The weights are adjusted as training progresses, with the goal of alleviating the dominating effect of easy-negative examples.
answers: One can think $(1-p_{i1})$ as a weight associated with each example, which changes as training proceeds. The intuition of changing $p_{i1}$ to $(1-p_{i1}) p_{i1}$ is to push down the weight of easy examples. For easy examples whose probability are approaching 0 or 1, $(1-p_{i1}) p_{i1}$ makes the model attach significantly less focus to them. Figure FIGREF23 gives gives an explanation from the perspective in derivative: the derivative of $\frac{(1-p)p}{1+(1-p)p}$ with respect to $p$ approaches 0 immediately after $p$ approaches 0, which means the model attends less to examples once they are correctly classified.
associates each training example with a weight in proportion to $(1-p)$, and this weight dynamically changes as training proceeds

pred: A semicharacter architecture is a type of neural network architecture that processes a sentence of words with misspelled characters, predicting the correct words at each step. It is used as a defense mechanism against character-level adversarial attacks in natural language processing. The architecture is based on a recurrent neural network (RNN) that takes in a sequence of words with misspelled characters and outputs the correct words. The RNN is trained on a dataset of misspelled words and their correct spellings, and the output is used as input to a downstream task such as sentiment analysis or paraphrase detection. The semicharacter architecture has
answers: A semi-character based RNN (ScRNN) treats the first and last characters individually, and is agnostic to the ordering of the internal characters
processes a sentence of words with misspelled characters, predicting the correct words at each step

pred: Masking words in the decoder helps to generate more complete input sequences that are consistent with BERT's pre-training process, which improves the quality of generated context vectors. This, in turn, leads to more fluent and natural sequences. Additionally, the refine decoder can be seen as a form of cloze task, which allows the decoder to leverage BERT's ability to generate high-quality context vectors. Overall, masking words in the decoder is a helpful technique for improving the performance of natural language generation models.
answers: ecause this process is similar to the cloze task in BERT's pre-train process, therefore by using the ability of the contextual language model the decoder can generate more fluent and natural sequences.

pred: The dataset is annotated with 9,473 annotations for 9,300 tweets, with each tweet being classified as either no evidence of depression or evidence of depression, and further annotated with one or more depressive symptoms if applicable. The annotations are based on a hierarchical model of depression-related symptoms.
answers: no evidence of depression, depressed mood, disturbed sleep, fatigue or loss of energy
The annotations are based on evidence of depression and further annotated by the depressive symptom if there is evidence of depression

pred: The baseline for the task was a very simple logistic regression classifier with default parameters, where the input instances were represented with a single feature: the length of the sentence.
answers: The baseline system for the SLC task is a very simple logistic regression classifier with default parameters. The baseline for the FLC task generates spans and selects one of the 18 techniques randomly.

pred: The political bias of different sources is included in the model by using a Balanced Random Forest with default parameters. The model is trained on left-biased and right-biased sources separately and tested on the entire set of sources. The model also excludes specific sources that have a large number of samples to prevent overfitting.
answers: By assigning a political bias label to each news article and training only on left-biased or right-biased outlets of both disinformation and mainstream domains

we also account for political biases inherent to different news sources, referring to the procedure proposed in BIBREF2 to label different outlets. Overall we show that we are able to classify credible vs non-credible diffusion networks (and consequently news articles) with high accuracy (AUROC up to 94%), even when accounting for the political bias of sources (and training only on left-biased or right-biased articles). We observe that the layer of mentions alone conveys useful information for the classification, denoting a different usage of this functionality when sharing news belonging to the two news domains. We also show that most discriminative features, which are relative to the breadth and depth of largest cascades in different layers, are the same across the two countries.

pred: The clinical datasets used in the paper are NUBes-PHI and MEDDOCAN. NUBes-PHI is a corpus of around 7,000 real medical reports written in Spanish and annotated with negation and uncertainty information. MEDDOCAN is a synthetic corpus of clinical cases enriched with sensitive information by health documentalists. The MEDDOCAN dataset is used in the paper to compare the BERT-based model to other established models for sensitive information detection and classification in Spanish clinical text. The MEDDOCAN dataset contains more sensitive information annotations than NUBes-PHI, and the sensitive annotation categories in MEDDOCAN differ from those
answers: MEDDOCAN, NUBes-PHI
MEDDOCAN, NUBes

pred: The metrics used to establish that this makes chatbots more knowledgeable and better at learning and conversation are predictive quality and strategy formulation ability. The article also mentions that the system's ability to learn and improve over time is a key factor in making chatbots more effective. Additionally, the system's ability to handle unknown concepts and entities is a significant advantage over previous chatbot systems. Overall, the article suggests that this approach to chatbot development has the potential to significantly improve the quality and effectiveness of chatbots in a variety of applications.
answers: Coverage, Avg. MCC and avg. +ve F1 score

pred: The article describes experiments conducted on the generation of ironic sentences from non-ironic sentences, as well as the generation of non-ironic sentences from ironic sentences. The experiments involve using a neural network to control the irony accuracy, sentiment preservation, and content preservation of the generated sentences. The article also discusses the challenges of modeling ironies and the limitations of current approaches to generating ironic sentences. The article concludes by suggesting future directions for research in this area.
answers: Irony Classifier, Sentiment Classifier for Irony, Sentiment Classifier for Non-irony, transformation from ironic sentences to non-ironic sentences

pred: Gaussian-masked directional multi-head attention works by adjusting the weight between characters and their adjacent characters to a larger value, which represents the effect of adjacent characters. This is achieved by using a Gaussian weight matrix that takes into account the distance between characters and sets the weight to 1 when the distance is 0. The larger the distance between characters, the smaller the weight, which allows for more accurate modeling of the localness of the input sequence. The Gaussian-masked directional multi-head attention is used in the proposed model to capture the localness and position information of the input sequence, which is important for Chinese word segmentation tasks.
answers: pays attentions to adjacent characters and casts a localness relationship between the characters as a fixed Gaussian weight assuming the weight relies on the distance between characters

Gaussian-masked directional attention can be described as a function to map queries and key-value pairs to the representation of input, Gaussian-masked directional attention expects to pay attention to the adjacent characters of each positions and cast the localness relationship between characters as a fix Gaussian weight for attention, Gaussian weight only relys on the distance between characters

pred: The baseline features are the features extracted from the fully-connected layer of the network used for sentiment analysis. They are found to be very effective for sarcasm detection. The network's baseline features are also found to be more effective than the pre-trained features alone. The combination of baseline features with pre-trained features improves the overall performance and generalizability of the network. The pre-trained features include sentiment, emotion, and personality features. The pre-trained features are found to be less effective than the baseline features alone, but they still contribute to the network's overall performance. The pre-trained features are also found to be highly correlated with each other. Overall
answers: The features extracted from CNN.

pred: The number of clusters was varied in the experiments on the four tasks. The hyperparameters for the learning algorithm and feature extraction steps were kept constant across all experiments. The type of word vectors (skipgram, cbow, or GloVe) was also varied, but the article suggests that one should first try skip-gram embeddings of low dimensionality (100) and high number of clusters (e.g., 1000) as the results obtained using these settings are consistently competitive. The article also suggests that using out-of-domain data, like Wikipedia articles in this case, to construct the word embeddings is a good practice, as the results obtained
